channel.title: math.GR updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GR updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Low-genus primitive monodromy groups with a nonunique minimal normal subgroup
item.description: arXiv:2501.15538v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $f:X\to\mathbb P^1_\mathbb C$ be an indecomposable covering of genus $g$ whose monodromy group has more than one minimal normal subgroup. Closing a gap in the literature, we show that there is only one such covering when $g\leq 1$. Moreover, for arbitrary $g$, there are no such coverings with $n\gg_g 0$ sufficiently large.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Gerhardt, Eilidh McKemmie, Danny Neftin

item.title: Random unipotent Sylow subgroups of groups of Lie type of bounded rank
item.description: arXiv:2501.15772v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In 2001 Liebeck and Pyber showed that a finite simple group of Lie type is a product of $ 25 $ carefully chosen unipotent Sylow subgroups. Later, in a series of works it was shown that $ 4 $ unipotent Sylow subgroups suffice. We prove that if the rank of a finite simple group of Lie type $ G $ is bounded, then $ G $ is a product of $ 11 $ random unipotent Sylow subgroups with probability tending to $ 1 $ as $ |G| $ tends to infinity. An application of the result to finite linear groups is given. The proofs do not depend on the classification of finite simple groups.
item.dc:creator: Saveliy V. Skresanov

item.title: Categories of skew left braces and trifactorised groups
item.description: arXiv:2501.16089v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The main objective of this paper is to deepen the relationship between skew left braces and trifactorised groups that encodes the information about skew left braces, their structure, their quotients, and their homomorphisms.
item.dc:creator: A. Ballester-Bolinches, R. Esteban-Romero, P. P\'erez-Altarriba, V. P\'erez-Calabuig

item.title: Complexity of Minimal Faithful Permutation Degree for Fitting-free Groups
item.description: arXiv:2501.16039v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we investigate the complexity of computing the minimal faithful permutation degree for groups without abelian normal subgroups. When our groups are given as quotients of permutation groups, we establish that this problem is in $\textsf{P}$. Furthermore, in the setting of permutation groups, we obtain an upper bound of $\textsf{NC}$ for this problem. This improves upon the work of Das and Thakkar (STOC 2024), who established a Las Vegas polynomial-time algorithm for this class in the setting of permutation groups.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levet, Pranjal Srivastava, Dhara Thakkar

item.title: Combinatorics of affine cactus groups
item.description: arXiv:2501.16270v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This article deals with the study of affine cactus groups from a combinatorial point of view. Those groups are extensions of cactus groups, which are related to braid and diagram groups and have gained an important place in many mathematics topics. We first show that affine cactus groups may be described as cactus groups on Coxeter groups of type eAn. Then, we prove that these groups embed into a semi-direct product of Coxeter groups, which allows us to obtain a number of combinatorial properties of affine cactus groups, such as the solubility of the world problem or the fact that their centre is trivial.
item.dc:creator: Hugo Chemin

item.title: Free dilations of families of $\mathcal{C}_{0}$-semigroups
item.description: arXiv:2501.16314v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Commuting families of contractions or contractive $\mathcal{C}_{0}$-semigroups on Hilbert spaces often fail to admit power dilations resp. simultaneous unitary dilations which are themselves commutative (see [32, 11, 13]). There is however much room for non-commutative results. Sz.-Nagy [43] and Bo\.{z}ejko [4] provided means to dilate families of contractions to (in general non-commuting) families of unitaries. To complement this, the present work extends this discrete-time result to families of contractive $\mathcal{C}_{0}$-semigroups. We refer to these dilations as continuous-time \emph{free unitary dilations} and present three distinct approaches to obtain them: 1) an explicit derivation applicable to semigroups that arise as interpolations; 2) a full proof with an explicit construction which utilises the theory of co-generators \`{a} la S{\l}oci\'{n}ski [39, 40]; and 3) a second full proof based on the abstract structure of semigroups. We then reformulate such non-commuting systems naturally as semigroups defined over topological free products of $\mathbb{R}$, deriving weak approximation and residuality results in the process. Under this setup we discuss applications to Chernoff approximations, random evolutions, and evolution families.
item.dc:creator: Raj Dahya

item.title: $\ell^p$ metrics on cell complexes
item.description: arXiv:2302.03801v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Motivated by the observation that groups can be effectively studied using metric spaces modelled on $\ell^1$, $\ell^2$, and $\ell^\infty$ geometry, we consider cell complexes equipped with an $\ell^p$ metric for arbitrary $p$. Under weak conditions that can be checked locally, we establish nonpositive curvature properties of these complexes, such as Busemann-convexity and strong bolicity. We also provide detailed information on the geodesics of these metrics in the special case of CAT(0) cube complexes.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Haettel, Nima Hoda, Harry Petyt

item.title: The geometry of conjugation in affine Coxeter groups
item.description: arXiv:2407.08080v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We develop new and precise geometric descriptions of the conjugacy class $[x]$ and coconjugation set $\operatorname{C}(x,x') = \{ y \in \overline{W} \mid yxy^{-1} = x' \}$ for all elements $x,x'$ of any affine Coxeter group $\overline{W}$. The centralizer of $x$ in $\overline{W}$ is the special case $\operatorname{C}(x,x)$. The key structure in our description of the conjugacy class $[x]$ is the mod-set ${Mod}_{\overline{W}}(w) = (w-\operatorname{I})R^\vee$, where~$w$ is the finite part of $x$ and $R^\vee$ is the coroot lattice. The coconjugation set $\operatorname{C}(x,x')$ is then described by ${Mod}_{\overline{W}}(w')$ together with the fix-set of $w'$, where $w'$ is the finite part of $x'$. For any element $w$ of the associated finite Weyl group $W$, the mod-set of $w$ is contained in the classical move-set ${Mov}(w) = \operatorname{Im}(w - \operatorname{I})$. We prove that the rank of ${Mod}_{\overline{W}}(w)$ equals the dimension of ${Mov}(w)$, and then further investigate type-by-type the surprisingly subtle structure of the $\mathbb{Z}$-module ${Mod}_\overline{W}(w)$. As corollaries, we determine exactly when ${Mod}_{\overline{W}}(w) = {Mov}(w) \cap R^\vee$, in which case our closed-form descriptions of conjugacy classes and coconjugation sets are as simple as possible.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Mili\'cevi\'c, Petra Schwer, Anne Thomas

item.title: Quantitative Preservations of Ulam Stability-type Estimates
item.description: arXiv:2411.02474v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show some preservation results of amenably extending strongly Ulam stable groups under mild decay assumptions, including quantitative preservation of asymptotic bounds under the assumption that the modulus of stability is H\"older continuous of exponent $s>\frac 1 2$ at 0, utilizing some simplistic integral estimates. Additionally, we show some partial results around inductive preservation of modulus bounds in infinite dimensions using these integral estimates, as well as strong quantitative preservation in the finite dimensional case. This implies the existence of $\mathfrak{U}$ uniformly stable existential closures among groups with sufficiently large Lipschitz estimates of any countable group. Finally, we show quantitative control preserving difficulty of approximation of maps over stable groups on diagonally embedding into higher dimensions.
item.dc:creator: Mason Sharp

item.title: Vanishing Elements of Prime Power Order
item.description: arXiv:2501.13605v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The conjugacy classes and the vanishing elements of a finite group (i.e. elements where some irreducible character of the group vanishes) are among many basic invariants associated to a finite group. These invariants have shown their influence on the structure of groups. In recent years, the effect of combination of both the invariants has been widely studied. In this paper, we study the effect of vanishing elements of prime power order and their conjugacy classes on the structure of a group. We obtain a generalization of some recent results by Dolfi, Pacifici and Sanus (2010), and by Robati (2020).
item.dc:creator: Sonakshee Arora, Rahul Dattatraya Kitture

item.title: Common divisor graphs for skew braces
item.description: arXiv:2306.12415v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We introduce two common divisor graphs associated with a finite skew brace, based on its $\lambda$- and $\theta$-orbits. We prove that the number of connected components is at most two and the diameter of a connected component is at most four. Furthermore, we investigate their relationship with isoclinism. Similarly to its group theoretic inspiration, the skew braces with a graph with two disconnected vertices are very restricted and are determined. Finally, we classify all finite skew braces with a graph with one vertex, where four infinite families arise.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Journal of Pure and Applied Algebra, Volume 229, Issue 2, 2025
item.dc:creator: Silvia Properzi, Arne Van Antwerpen
